description: Identifier of the mapping template used to parse incoming fuel files for this configuration.
Code indicating the file structure used for import (e.g., delimited vs fixed-width); likely selects parsing rules; confirm with SME.
Flag to update vehicle odometer/hourmeter from values in imported fuel records.
Enforces validation of driver identifiers from the feed against master records during import.
Enforces validation of account or card numbers from the feed against master records during import.
Controls printing or generating a report of successfully parsed fuel transactions.
Determines whether validated imports are committed to the database or run as a dry-run/preview.
Indicates this setup targets the Fuelman card program; likely alters field mapping and rules; confirm with SME.
Controls printing or logging of detailed error reports for rejected records.
Pattern used to parse dates in incoming files for this configuration.
Indicates whether meter-only readings from the feed are created as transactions; confirm behavior with SME.
Next scheduled calendar date for the automated import job to run.
Next scheduled time of day for the automated import job; time zone may be system default; confirm with SME.
Numeric interval for the import schedule (e.g., every N units); used with the frequency unit; confirm with SME.
Time unit for the schedule interval (minutes, hours, days, etc.); used with the frequency number; confirm with SME.
Activates or deactivates this configuration for use by the system.
Primary default product/stock code applied to imported transactions when the feed lacks a valid code; confirm exact usage with SME.
Secondary fallback product/stock code used if primary default does not apply; confirm exact usage with SME.
Additional fallback product/stock code for mapping ambiguous or missing product entries; confirm with SME.
Fourth-level fallback product/stock code for import mapping when prior defaults fail; confirm with SME.
Permits zero-quantity records, typically for meter-only submissions or tests.
User who created this configuration record.
Timestamp when this configuration record was created.
User who last modified this configuration record.
Timestamp of the most recent update to this configuration record.
Character set expected for the incoming file content.
Number of initial rows to ignore before reading data lines from the file.
Enforces validation of product/stock codes from the feed against inventory master data.
Field separator character used for parsing delimited files (e.g., comma, tab); confirm with SME.
Validates meter readings for reasonableness or sequence (e.g., nondecreasing values); confirm specific rules with SME.
